text: Transcription factor NF-E2 is crucial for regulation of erythroid - specific gene expression .
<extra_id_0> p45 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunit of NF-E2 contains a basic-leucine zipper domain and dimerizes with the small Maf family protein to form functional NF-E2 complex .

While <extra_id_0> p45 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was shown to be restricted to erythroid cells , megakaryocytes and mast cells in hematopoietic lineage , we found in this study that <extra_id_0> p45 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA is abundantly transcribed in the granulocyte fraction of human peripheral blood cells .

text: As neutrophils occupy approximately 92 % of the cells in granulocyte fraction of human peripheral blood cells .
As neutrophils occupy approximately 92 % of the cells in this fraction , the cells expressing <extra_id_0> p45 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is most likely to be neutrophils .
<extra_id_0> p45 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA is also expressed in HL-60 promyelocytes , albeit the expression level is much lower than that of the granulocyte fraction .
